benchmark_details.name: ToolGrad-5K
benchmark_details.overview: ToolGrad-5K is a tool-use dataset generated through an agentic framework that constructs valid tool-use chains with a 100% pass rate, enabling efficient data generation for teaching LLMs tool usage capabilities.
benchmark_details.data_type: triplets of (user prompt, tool-use chains, AI responses)

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The primary objective of ToolGrad-5K is to efficiently generate synthetic tool-use datasets for large language models through a novel framework.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: While ToolGrad improves efficiency, it does not ensure real-world alignment of user inquiries.

data.source: Generated through the ToolGrad framework utilizing a large-scale API database.
data.annotation: Automatically generated using the ToolGrad framework.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are derived by evaluating the success of generated triplets and the efficiency of the tool-use process.
methodology.interpretation: A pass rate of 100% indicates successful generation of usable examples, while the number of tool uses reflects the complexity of generated data.
methodology.baseline_results: Compared with ToolBench, ToolGrad-5K boasts a 100% pass rate compared to a 63.8% pass rate from DFS.
methodology.validation: The dataset was validated by its construction process, ensuring each triplet was successfully generated.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: BY-CC license for all artifacts, including dataset and fine-tuned models.
